name: Coronation (Mbdot00)
description:
Become a King/Queen, Hold Council Meetings, Build Castles, Trade and Prosper, Engage in Melee Directional Combat!

Coronation is a Medieval Kingdom Multiplayer Game developed by the creators of The Lordaeron Empires v2.4c Warcraft III custom map.

In our Current Demo, you can:

  • Gather resources
  • Build a town with a Fortnite-styled building system
  • Trade and hire Villagers or Mercenaries from visiting Merchants
  • Assign Forager, Lumberjack, Miner, Blacksmith jobs to Villagers
  • Give area commands to nearby Villagers
  • Conquer other players' towns and pillage their loot
  • Try to conquer the whole land

More features to be added to the Demo:

  • Start off as a Peasant and climb the medieval corporate ladder
  • Work in medieval job professions such as Farmer, Fisherman, Hunter, Blacksmith, Tailor, Guard...
  • Sit and eat cooked food together with NPCs
  • Socialize with the villagers and build close relationships
  • Buy Land and build your own house with furniture
  • Plan parties and celebrate
  • Start up businesses such as Taverns, Inns, Restaurant, Shops...
  • Become a wealthy Merchant by completing trade contracts and form your own Army to protect your assets from Bandits
  • Become a Lord and create new towns to lease the Land for other players to buy
  • Become a King/Queen, maintain the Throne and hold Council meetings
  • Wage wars with other players
  • Conquer the entire land and become Emperor of the whole Kingdom

Here's a list of games that have inspired us:

Rust, Mount & Blade Bannerlord, Anno 1404, Total War Medieval 2, Mabinogi, RuneScape, Banished, Tropico 6.

A little background info about us:

My brother and I are working on the game full-time, 12 hours or more on it everyday, using our savings earned from our previous construction engineering jobs. We want to make our dream world a reality, where people experience realistic medieval life.

Please add the game to your collection! It will be free to play when it's released in August 2021.
